intro: Villebrunea rhodopleura, commonly known as the red-veined or red-leafed hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety red leaves with prominent green veins, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, typically blooming during the summer months. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Villebrunea rhodopleura is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant foliage and seasonal floral display.
